command: [withheld] PowerShell launching wscript.exe to execute a Microsoft-signed administrative VBScript from System32 that immediately spawns an interpreter (details redacted).
explanation: Generalized signed script proxy execution via wscript.exe where a trusted admin script is coerced into creating an unintended child process, often used to sidestep application whitelisting.
rationale_steps: Parent is powershell.exe with user-level token.
wscript.exe command line references a system-signed VBScript (Printing_Admin_Scripts, App-V, etc.).
Rapid child process creation of an interpreter or LOLBin not associated with the script’s intended function.
Arguments include irregular quoting, delimiters, or network paths.
Cross-check for absence of the administrative action that the script normally performs.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: No actual command string is provided—only a description—so it cannot be parsed or validated for syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The described behavior aligns with T1216 by using wscript.exe to run a signed System32 VBScript that proxies execution to an interpreter on Windows, though missing specifics prevent full operational verification.
